intro: Chrysobalanus luteus, commonly known as the yellow chrysobalanus, is a tropical tree native to regions of South America and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and elongated, elliptical leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing a single large seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
